Message.Title: What CNBC idiot asked if Microsoft is a sell?
Message.Msg: They are about to release the greatest innovation of our lifetimes. That is the XBOX One. Most stocks would rally on a 5 year exclusive agreement with the NFL. Their will be a surfaces used in the stadiums. There will be extra insights into the sidelines and stats on the screen, etc. The XBOX ONE is a cable pass through device. Any moron can plug a cable in. It hooks up to a large screen TV. Do you really think that the billions of football fans will not want this. The experience will be heaven for an actual football fan. Plus, some cable plans make you pay extra for you local teams. Believe it or not. The NFL package and the competition on cable plans will make for better deals. In the past everyone got screwed by cable and contracts. Now they are going to be competing for XBOX ONE customers. You will have the upper hand and only pay for what you want. Say TV ON. SAY Redskins vc Cowboys. The game comes on. Say find Americas got Talent and it comes on. Play Windows 8 apps, browse bing and see incoming SKYPE video conferencing calls in HD. Oh yea, you get a blue Ray Player. Sure as hell does not sound like a sell for crying out loud.

Topic.Title: Xbox One is to msft as Iphone to aapl

Message.Msg: If you have a Nokia Lumia and your XBOX One is in CA. and you are in NY, you will be able to access it with an Internet connection or your phone. You have an XBOX app on the Nokia Lumia's and you can access your Microsoft account from any internet connection. The XBOX ONE will have a cable by pass. Some cable companies offer take it with you. Meaning, you can watch shows or movies or whatever is on your XBOX one from where you are. It has not been finalized how everything will be tied in or announced. The SKYPE and classifications if it is a Telco or if the Telco's will allow it are not know to the public yet. They currently have clauses in their contracts with ATT, etc that says that ATT can restrict Skype services on Microsoft phones sold by ATT if they want. So I have no idea how all these competition things will play out. Verizon is offering it's own NFL streaming to phones and Microsoft has an exclusive agreement with NFL on XBOX. So their is competition there also. Verizon only wants to let the 4 g lte viewers on certain plans view the NFL. So it sounds like they want to make money on the overages of data. I still have an unlimited mobile data connection with Verizon that is not eligible for the NFL streaming and they have tried every trick in the book to try and get me out of the unlimited plan and into a data plan with limits. How they will feel about a customer using a Nokia Lumia and accessing the XBOX one to watch the NFL versus their own live streaming is beyond me. There are major competition issues and the connectivity will be limited at first so they do not tick off ATT & Verizon. They still have to sell Windows Phones through them. I suspect Microsoft will limit the full potential of Skype because they would upset every Telco tremendously and will definitely shake it up.

Topic.Title: Haswell and Broadwell will end AAPL and Google for good....

Message.Msg: so you think haswell kill msft too? "Several Android tablets running on Intel Clover Trail+ Atom processors broke cover at Computex Taiwan. Intelâ€™s dual-core, 1.6GHz Atom Z5260 is fueling a Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 10.1 tablet, as well as Asusâ€™s 6-inch Fonepad Note and 10-inch MemoPad FHD10 tablets, while Asus also unveiled a hybrid 11.6-inch Transformer Book Trio, combining an Android slate based on a 2GHz dual-core Atom Z2580 with a keyboard dock running Windows 8 on an Intel Haswell processor. Earlier this year, we saw several Android smartphones running on Intelâ€™s new Clover Trail+ (CT+) architecture instead of the usual ARM Cortex SoCs (system-on-chips), and now here come the tablets. Between Samsung and Asus, four Android-on CT+ tablets were demonstrated at the Computex show in Taiwan today. As expected, Samsung unveiled its 10.1-inch Galaxy Tab 3 tablet and, as several earlier reports had rumored, the device is Samsungâ€™s first Android product to run on an Intel x86 processor. The Galaxy Tab 3 10.1 (pictured; click to enlarge) is built around Intelâ€™s CT+ based Atom Z2560 SoC, according to several sources including The Verge. The Galaxy Tab 3 10.1â€²s specs align with previous leaks, including the presence of a Z2560 with dual 1.6GHz cores, and a fairly modest, 1280 x 800-pixel (149ppi) WXGA resolution 10.1-inch display. Thereâ€™s only 1GB of RAM, but customers can choose between 16GB or 32GB of internal storage."
